summary: This is a Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum transmitting an Office of the Inspector General (OIG) investigative report regarding staff misconduct related to the death of Jeffrey Epstein. It lists Bureau of Prisons personnel against whom misconduct was sustained, including inattention to duty, failure to follow policy, lack of candor, and falsification of documents.

events.title: Transmittal of OIG Report
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons Office of Internal Affairs transmits the OIG investigative report to wardens, detailing sustained misconduct findings against staff.

keyFacts: The document is a 2023 memorandum transmitting the OIG's investigative report on staff misconduct related to Jeffrey Epstein's death.

Misconduct was sustained against several Bureau of Prisons staff, including Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, for Inattention to Duty, Failure to Follow Policy, Lack of Candor, and Falsification of Documents.
The OIG case numbers (2019-05324, 2019-010614/2019-011626) indicate the investigation began in 2019, following Epstein's death.
The memorandum instructs wardens to notify the Office of Internal Affairs of any disciplinary action taken against the named staff.
